Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Lack \Lack\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Lacked} (l[a^]kt); p. pr. & vb. n. {Lacking}.] 1. To blame; to find fault with. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
Love them and lakke them not. --Piers Plowman. [1913 Webster]
2. To be without or destitute of; to want; to need. [1913 Webster]
If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God. --James i. 5. [1913 Webster]

lacking adj 1: not existing; "innovation has been sadly lacking"; "character development is missing from the book" [syn: {lacking(p)}, {missing}, {nonexistent}, {wanting(a)}] 2: inadequate in amount or degree; "a deficient education"; "deficient in common sense"; "lacking in stamina"; "tested and found wanting" [syn: {deficient}, {lacking(p)}, {wanting(p)}]
